chart_description: The Swap Utilization chart shows the amount of swap memory that is available and used on a Windows system. Swap memory, also known as virtual memory, is a portion of a hard disk that is used to supplement the physical RAM when it becomes fully utilized. A high swap utilization rate can indicate that the system is running low on physical RAM or that there are memory leaks in the system.

dimension_descriptions.available: The amount of swap memory that is currently available on the Windows system, in bytes.
dimension_descriptions.used: The amount of swap memory that is currently being used on the Windows system, in bytes.
